snippet: The military-backed government in Egypt had hinted at a milder clearing operation that would last days. But when it came, protesters appeared stunned by its fury.
abstract: Egypt's military-backed government had hinted at milder siege to clear pro-Morsi encampments, but when crackdown came, protesters appeared stunned by its fury; Egypt's leaders moved against Morsi's supporters with brutality and resolve, despite leaking plans about a clearing operation that would last days and include warnings, nonlethal weapons and safe passage for women and children.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: The military-backed government in Egypt had hinted at a milder clearing operation that would last days. But when it came, protesters appeared stunned by its fury.

headline.main: Fierce and Swift Raids on Islamists Bring Sirens, Gunfire, Then Screams
headline.print_headline: In Fierce and Swift Attack on Camps: Sirens, Gunfire, Then Screams of Pain

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
